div.head: 燥澀
div.div: dryness and roughness; dry and rough

bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

entry.def: dryness and roughness; dry and rough

sense.def: ① Illness Sign identical with zao jie 燥結 , dryness nodes. Sheng ji zong lu 聖濟總錄 179: 實熱之氣，歸於 大腸，故大便燥澀而不通也 , “The qi of repletion heat turns to the large intestine. Hence the stools are dry and rough , and fail to pass”.

② Secondary Etiological Condition identical with gan se 乾澀 , desiccated and rough. Shang han zhi ge 傷寒直格 Lj: 難產 或死胎不下，皆由風熱燥澀，緊斂結滯而不能舒緩，故產戶不得自然開 通也 , “In the case of difficult deliveries or if the fetus has died and does not descend, the reason is wind heat has brought about dryness and roughness . This makes [the birth canal] be tight with nodular and sluggish [qi] rather than allowing it to relax. Hence the birth gate cannot open by itself”.
